tr.td: Dialysis payable separately as an add on package

Rs. 5000 is the upper limit. Can be booked at a lower rate also. In fact the SHA should examine this package and confirm wheter the package has been booked at the usual market rate. Can be booked for a pt. already admitted under any medical package.
The Procedure will cover ALL, Hodgkin's Lymphoma, Wilm's Tumour, NHL, Retinoblastoma & certain Bone Tumours`
Can be used for ORIF, wherever indicated. Can not be used as an Add - on package

Surgical Management for Type III & IV Rockwood to be decided by the surgeon on case to case basis Type V & VI to be taken up for Surgery straight away In case Type I or II is booked a Pop Up to be shown "For Rockwood Type I & II - AC Joint injury, experts recommend Medical Management, are you sure you want to do Surgical Correction in this case ?" For Hospitals booking Surgical Correction in Type I & Type II cases, Medical Audit will be conducted.
Surgical Management for Type III & IV Rockwood to be decided by the surgeon on case to case basis Type V & VI to be taken up for Surgery straight away
LA for - K Wire & Screw GA for - Nail & Plate
If the Hospital choses Pediatric Port in a pt. aged more than 14 years. Then it should be audited
The package is inclusive of Eye Bank processing fee

This is a special follow up package, as in Corneal graft surgery, a follow up at 1 week is required. At this time, the surgeon has to examine and then prescribe medicine for next one month. The medicine for 1 month has to be given at the time of booking this package. A signed reciept from the pt. is an essential document
To be done only after a prior scleral buckling surgery history
Can be booked only after 1 year of cataract surgery
Can be booked as a complication of cataract surgery atleast 15 days after discharge
The procedure is done only once per eye and not repeated
1. Claim to be raised after all 3 sittings have been done per eye. 2. The interval between subsequent sittings is atleast 1 week.
Pre-auth to be raised only in cases which have a prior history of Vitreoretinal surgery done atleast 3 months ago

Can be booked only after 15 days of Ileostomy and then every 2 months thereafter till the closure of stoma. The Hospital has to upload a signed statement from pt. that s/he has received the cosnumables: Ileostomy - bags, adhesive, clips etc for 2 months

Can be booked only after 15 days of Colostomy and then every 2 months thereafter till the closure of stoma. The Hospital has to upload a signed statement from pt. that s/he has received the cosnumables: colostomy - bags, adhesive, clips etc for 2 months
Payment to be made after completion of one month.
Claim to be raised after 6th Cycle
Claim for Rs. 15,000 can be raised after 6th Cycle. Remainaing Rs. 15,000 can be claimed after 12th Cycle
No payment to be done to the Hospital for this stage The package can be booked only if the first stage package has been booked prior to this
The package can be booked only if the first stage and / or intermediate stage package has been booked prior to this

Associated with CABG Need to submit Barcode/ ID number of IABP. Intra-operative use of IABP as a part of operative strategy, not included Incidence - 5% to 7% Scrutiny of Hospitals where incidence is more than twice of prescribed limit
Adjuvant therapy in breast cancer Metastatic breast cancer (should not have received the same regimen or AC earlier)
Adjuvant therapy after 4 cycles of AC or EC
Adjuvant therapy in breast cancer with cardiac dysfunction or not suitable for anthracycline based therapy Metstatic breast cancer (should not have received the same regimen earlier)

Adjuvant therapy in breast cancer with cardiac dysfunction or not suitable for anthracycline based therapy and high nodal burden Metastatic breast cancer (should not have received the same regimen earlier)
Adjuvant therapy in breast cancer with Her-2 neu positive patients
Adjuvant or neoadjuvant therapy in ER / PR psotive breast cancer ER / PR positive metastatic breast cancer (if not receive earlier)
Adjuvant or neoadjuvant therapy in ER / PR psotive breast cancer ER / PR positive metastatic breast cancer
Adjuvant or neoadjuvant therapy breast cancer metastatic breast cancer (if not received earlier)
Adjuvant therapy in breast cancer Metstatic breast cancer (should not have received the same regimen or EC earlier)
Metastatic breast cancer ER / PR positive
Adjuvant or neoadjuvant therapy breast cancer metastatic breast cancer
Metastatic breast cancer ER / PR positive
Metastatic bone malignancy and multiple myeloma
Neoadjuvant, adjuvant and metastatic ovarian adenocarcinoma
Germ cell tumour of any site for Neoadjuvant, adjuvant or metastatic first line
Germ cell tumour second line therapy
First line therapy for high - risk Gestational Trophoblastic Neoplasia Second line
First line therapy for low risk Gestational Trophoblastic Neoplasia
Stage II and Stage III cervical cancer definitive therapy along with Radiation therapy
Neoadjuvant, Adjuvant and Metastatic Endometrial Cancer
Stage II and Stage III cervical cancer definitive therapy
Osteogenic carcinoma Neoadjuvant and adjuvant therapy
Soft tissue sarcoma neoadjuvant, adjuvant and metastatic
Stage II and III anal Cancer
Upper esophageal neoadjuvant and with RT as adjuvant
Metastatic second line esophageal and stomach cancer
Till RT ends Lower esophageal and stomach Cancer with RT as adjuvant
Till completion of RT Lower esophageal and stomach Cancer with RT as adjuvant
Adjuvant and Metastatic Stomach, Lower esophageal (adenocarcinoma) cancer
Neoadjuvant, adjuvant and metastatic stomach and lower esophageal (adenocarcinoma) cancer
Metatstaic lower esophageal and stomach Cancer
Adjuvant for stomach and lower esophageal (adenocarcinoma) cancer
Neoadjuvant, adjuvant, along with Radiation (concurrent), metastatic esophageal cancer
Meatastatic hepatocellular carcinoma (except child Pugh c) Liver confined but not suitable for liver directed therapy
Neoadjuvant and adjuvant locally advanced pancreatic cancer
Till RT ends Neoadjuvant and adjuvant locally advanced pancreatic cancer
Adjuvant and metastatic gall bladder and cholnagicarcinoma
Neoadjuvant, adjuvant and metastatic pancreatic cancer
Till RT ends Definitive and Adjuvant therapy in gall bladder cancer
Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy and metastatic thymic carcinoma
Neoadjuvant and metastatic head and neck squamou cell cancer
Metastatic squamous cell head and neck cancer, nasopharyngeal cancer, salivary gland cancers
Neoadjuvant, Metastatic squamou cell head and neck cancer, nasopharyngeal cancer, salivary gland cancers
Metastatic squamou cell head and neck cancer, salivary gland cancers
Metastatic Head and neck squamous cell carcinoma
Neoadjuvant, adjuvant and metastatic esthesioneuroblastoma and Neuroendocrine carcinoma
Metastatic squamous cell head and neck cancer, salivary gland cancers, nasopharyngeal carcinoma
Metastatic squamous cell head and neck cancer, salivary gland cancers
Multiagent chemotherapy variable in each protocol
Optional Vincristine and Prednsiolone Intrathecal Methotrexate
Optional Vincristine and Prednsiolone, intrathecal Methotrexate
Metstatic non small cell lung cancer - second line
Metastatic non small cell lung (adenocarcinoma) cancer
Metastatic small cell lung cancer - second line
Metastatic Non Small Cell Lung Cancer - in patients unfit for combination therapy
Neoadjuvant, concurrent with radiation and metastaic small cell lung cancer
Neoadjuvant and Metastatic Non Small Cell Lung cancer
Concurrent chemoradiation in Non Small Cell lung cancer
Neoadjuvant, Adjuvant and Metastatic Non Small Cell Lung cancer (adnocarcinoma and adenosquamous carcinoma)
Metastatic non small cell lung cancer (adenocarcinoma) as maintenance after Carboplatin + Pemetrexed and Cisplatin + Pemetrexed 4 -6 cycles
